email.title: Weekly Digest

image.alt: Stack of biscuits on a plate
image.title: Oddly satisfying

email.text:
Hi everyone!
The past week week was another fun week, with ice skating sessions by the Natural History Museum and a great security talk from Facebook.
In the coming week, we have another social trip (to watch The Book of Mormon), followed by two major events: our joint diversity panel event with CGCU on Thursday and Google DevFest London on Saturday. Also, Liquidnet have an open office on Tuesday, involving casual networking drinks open to all DoCSoc members, so if you're looking for a relaxed evening in the City of London, this would be a good opportunity to take. Read on for more information!
email.heading: DevFest Volunteers
email.text: DevFest is _this_ Saturday (1st December)! The event is already sold out, with 1000 people attending. We need as many hands as possible for this event so if you're interested in helping out, join the [DoCSoc: Operations](https://www.facebook.com/groups/1509850436007222/) group.
email.heading: Careers Service: CV Reviews
email.text:
Looking to get your CV reviewed? The Careers Service has an online review system, My CVs, where you can upload your CV, provide details and get feedback from the Careers team within three working days.
To get started, upload your CV under the "My Profile" section of [JobsLive](http://www.imperial.ac.uk/careers/services/jobslive/).
email.heading: CO Careers Talk: LinkedIn - Leverage the Power of Social Media
email.text:
This Friday, the Careers Service will be holding the last DoC Careers Talk of the year, where you'll learn how to make the most of LinkedIn to promote your personal brand and network effectively.
This talk will be held in HXLY 311 on Friday from 13:00 - 13:50.
email.heading: CGCU & DoCSoc - Diversity in Engineering

event.text:
**Submit your questions to the panel here: https://goo.gl/3j3e3w **
Open to all Imperial students!
CGCU & DoCSoc are very excited to announce our launch event of a brand new diversity initiative!
We have picked some of the most talented engineers from a range of backgrounds and engineering disciplines to feature in a live Q&A panel where they will be sharing their experiences and challenges throughout their career. This will be followed by a networking reception with drinks and canapés where engineers and recruiters will be able to share advice one on one with you. These engineers will be from a number of highly influential companies, including:
- Google - P&G - Bloomberg - Lendlease - Facebook - InterEngineering - Microsoft - Palantir
...and more yet to be announced!
_Note: Year 12/13 students will also be invited to this event where they will benefit from your own experiences during the networking session as much as the engineers' attending, should you wish to share. We invite you to come and play your part in pushing inclusion to the forefront of our engineering disciplines, however of course this is not mandatory._

email.heading: Google DevFest London 2018

event.text:
DoCSoc is proud to be hosting Google DevFest London on our very own campus this year! Read on for more information.
**Learn the latest in web, mobile, cloud, machine learning and more at the UK's largest community organised free conference.**
GDG London, Google and DoCSoc present GDG Devfest London - a multi-track event covering: cloud and machine learning; web; mobile; assistant; codelabs and demos.
To find out more about speakers, topics and agenda, visit devfest.gdg.london
Don’t miss out on a fun, interesting and informative day of expert speakers, demo stands coding labs and much much more.
You’ll also get the chance to network with experts from Google, Imperial College and beyond and learn more from some of the amazing developer communities we have in London.
There will be people taking photographs and potentially filming the event. By attending you agree to the possibility of being photographed and filmed once inside the venue.
Thank you for your interest in GDG DevFest London and we look forward to seeing you there!
(Tickets are sold out, so if you have a ticket but are unable to attend, please release your ticket on Eventbrite so someone else can go!)

email.heading: Liquidnet In-Office Interactive Session: Trading, AI and Augmenting Behavior

event.location: Liquidnet Offices, 21st Floor, Broadgate Tower, Primrose St, London, EC2A 2EW
event.text:
JOIN LIQUIDNET CHIEF DATA SCIENTIST TOM DORIS, PHD. to discuss challenges in adoption and adherence of new technologies by human experts, deconstruct the methods that were effective in overcoming the obstacles, and review similarities across other industries.
There will be an opportunity to network with members of Tom's Technology team, our Recruitment Team and Product Team once the interactive session has ended.
Refreshments will be served.

email.heading: LSEG WIN Breakfast Sessions for Young Female Talents

event.location: LSEG City of London Global Headquarters, 10 Paternoster Square, London, EC4M 7LS
event.text:
**Limited spaces available!**
The **LSEG WIN (Women Inspired Network)** Community aims to provide a platform to celebrate female talents within and outside the Group. As part of the WIN Campus Taskforce, we’d like to invite a small group of elite female students from four top London universities (LSE, UCL, KCL, and Imperial College London) to attend our breakfast sessions to understand and explore the financial industry with the help of industry leaders and senior executives.
We are excited to offer this opportunity to young talented female students to help them to gain more exposure to financial markets, whilst networking with like-minded peers.
Our last breakfast session is **Alternative Career Options in Finance**, on Wednesday, 5 December, 9:00am – 10:00am. For more details, see the PDF attached.
Location: LSEG City of London Global Headquarters, 10 Paternoster Square, London EC4M 7LS
If you're interested, email DoCSoc at docsoc@imperial.ac.uk and they'll pass your details onto us!

email.heading: WinC@IC talks: Research Careers in Industry and Academia

event.text:
What do you want to do after your research degree? Do you want to learn more about the opportunities and challenges of continuing a career in research? Two wonderful speakers, Dr Emily Adlam and Dr Victoriia Sharmanska, will share their research interests and career paths within industry and academia.
**The Women in Computing group** at Imperial is thrilled to announce the first event of the year with two wonderful speakers, who will share their research interests and career paths within industry and academia.
**Emily Adlam** graduated with a PhD in theoretical physics from the University of Cambridge and currently works as a Quantitative Researcher G Research, a world-leading tech company that uses machine learning, artificial intelligence and big data analytics to predict prices in global financial markets.
**Victoriia Sharmanska** is a Research Fellow in the Department of Computing at Imperial, leading the project in 'Deep Understanding of Human Behaviour from Video Data: Action Emotion Approach'. Her research interests include deep learning methods and cross-modal transfer that are suitable for learning from complex visual data.
